snippet: Days after his spokesman said the requirement that people have insurance was not a tax, Mitt Romney said it was, aligning himself with the conservative voices in his party.
abstract: Presumptive Republican presidential nominee Mitt Romney declares that Pres Obama's health care mandate is in fact a tax, shifting his campaign characterization of the law and aligning himself with the conservative voices in his party; remarks prompt renewed criticisms that he is willing to adjust his views for political expediency, coming two days after his spokesman said the requirement that people have insurance was not a tax.
lead_paragraph: Days after his spokesman said the requirement that people have insurance was not a tax, Mitt Romney said it was, aligning himself with the conservative voices in his party.

headline.seo: Romney, in Shift, Says Health Care Mandate Is a Tax
headline.main: Romney Now Says Health Mandate by Obama Is a Tax
